responsibilities: Collaborate with global teams to deliver massively impactful data products globally.
Build ML pipelines that optimize critical processes for global lending products including anti-fraud, credit strategy, and marketing optimization.
Mentor other engineers and data scientists about best practices in ML engineering.
Take data products from conception to scale deployment.
qualifications: Expertise in machine learning algorithms, frameworks, and lifecycle: from data extraction and feature engineering to model serving and monitoring for live and batch processing.
High proficiency in Python and its related libraries and frameworks (e.g., Scikit-Learn, Pandas, Flask, FastAPI, etc).
Great interpersonal skills including strong written and verbal communication.
Experience with cloud providers (AWS preferred) and related data services.
analysis: The job responsibilities focus on building and optimizing machine learning (ML) pipelines for global lending products, improving ML infrastructure, and mentoring others in ML engineering. The skills required include expertise in machine learning algorithms, frameworks, and lifecycle, as well as proficiency in Python and related libraries. There is no specific mention of Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus seems to be on traditional machine learning applications related to lending products, such as anti-fraud and credit strategy, rather than on generative tasks or language model development and deployment.
